radiographic_examinations.findings: Consolidation within the lingula likely due to atelectasis. Calcified granuloma in the right lower lobe. Focal pleural calcifications near the right lower lobe. Trace right pleural effusion with associated atelectasis. Mild left basilar atelectasis. Distended gallbladder with wall thickening and pericholecystic fat stranding. Gallbladder wall discontinuity with adjacent pericholecystic collection indicative of perforation. Several gallstones in the gallbladder, including one in the gallbladder neck.
